definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: All sounds are still only moments, the mood will be cheerful jump.
sentences.chinese: 只有萬籟俱靜的時刻，心緒纔會歡快的跳躍。

sentences.english: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. 2. Brick quiz whangs veldt fox.
sentences.chinese: 關於磚頭的測驗把一隻跳躍的草原狐狸給難住了。

sentences.english: Some sports or games go back thousands of years, like running or jumping.
sentences.chinese: 有些運動或運動會追溯到幾千年，如跑步或跳躍。

sentences.english: and jump in leaves,there is no harm.
sentences.chinese: 在樹葉中跳躍，一點兒也不礙事。

sentences.english: An official throws the ball in the air as a player from each opposing team jumps to gain possession of the ball.
sentences.chinese: 裁判將球拋向空中，這時雙方的選手通過跳躍來爭球。

sentences.english: The style of the website, must have successional , cannot too too bouncing.
sentences.chinese: 網站的風格，一定要有連續性，不能太過於跳躍。

sentences.english: Cavorting pairs bow gracefully to each other.
sentences.chinese: 跳躍的伴侶，優雅地相互鞠躬。

sentences.english: The heavyweight danced around the ring like a lightweight.
sentences.chinese: 重量級選手像輕量級選手一樣在拳擊場上跳躍。

sentences.english: While dancing, they half-open their wings, and they jump around and sing for each other.
sentences.chinese: 當它們起舞時，半展翅膀跳躍，互相歌唱。

sentences.english: These intelligent approaches will Dingqiu animals, jumping, but also to human treatment.
sentences.chinese: 這種聰明的動物不僅會頂球，跳躍，還會給人類治病。

sentences.english: Aaron jumped a 15ft wide ravine on his motorcycle.
sentences.chinese: 他騎着摩托車跳躍一個15英尺寬的峽谷。

sentences.english: The deer went off at an easy lope .
sentences.chinese: 那鹿輕鬆地跳躍着去了。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, someone pressed the jump button.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，有人按下了跳躍鍵。

sentences.english: The lambs are gamboling about in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 小羊在田野裏四處跳躍。

sentences.english: The yellow dog at home is coming up and gaily around three people jump.
sentences.chinese: 家中的大黃迎上來，歡快地繞着仨人跳躍。

sentences.english: Firelight shadows began to shimmer and dance around the room.
sentences.chinese: 火光的影子開始在屋裏跳躍舞動。

definition: to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
sense of movement (often in a static work of art)/dynamic/vivid/lifelike
